column2: VERMONT DMV DRIVING TEST
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 2. Passing is prohibited:
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.

column2: 3. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column6: back up slowly.
column8: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 4. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column4: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.
column6: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.
column8: in spring.

column2: 5. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column8: Shift to a lower gear.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: No left turn
column8: No right turn

column2: 7. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column6: the left side
column8: the center

column2: 8. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column10: always sound their horn and stay alert.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad crossing
column8: Pass with caution

column2: 10. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: The bus is about to stop.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 11. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: Flagger ahead
column8: Mountain trail

column2: 13. Your vehicle must be inspected once a year:
column4: only if it is 5 years old or more.
column6: only if it is not running properly.
column8: to make sure it is safe.
column10: unless it is bearing a valid Vermont inspection sticker.

column2: 14. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column8: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 15. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column6: No U-turns
column8: All traffic turn right

column2: 17. Highway markings:
column4: are only found in school zones.
column6: are usually red and blue in color.
column8: only apply to motorcycles.

column2: 18. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your rearview mirror.
column6: you cannot see without moving your head.
column8: directly behind your vehicle.
column10: you see in your side mirror.

column2: 19. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.

column2: 20. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Wait for the next green light.
